txt.en: 'What is this?'
'And this is your seat, my friend.'
'It was crafted in the time before Smaug came to Erebor, but now he is gone and still it remains.'
Instance: The Legacy of Durin's Folk
'Take a look at it, if you wish.'
'It seems that one of our guests has not yet arrived.'
'You have been patient, my friends, but let us wait a moment longer on his behalf.'
'[placeholder], would you come over here?'
'Old, indeed! You look quite young for your age, King Thorin!'
'Although my folk celebrate all around us, I have prepared a special feast for my honoured guests.'
'Yes, I think a meal is just the thing.'
'This day we honour the dwarves of Thorin's company, those that battled the Enemy, those we hold in friendship, and those we have lost.'
'Each of them has served Durin's Folk honourably, and you are no exception.'
'All have earned a seat at my table....'
'Hail, King Under the Mountain!'
'The journey was long, but we came as swiftly as we could!'
'Nár!'
'You have travelled far, indeed. From the distant coomb of Thrór to our home in Erebor.'
'You have borne our old exile from Erebor as a burden of your own, and that is now ended.'
'It is my honour to welcome you to our halls. Will you and your companion join us for our feast, old friend?'
'Have a seat, old friend. There will be time enough for talk later!'
'Oh, fine! I am sorry to leave you, my friends, but I will return!'
'Náth! Did you hear Spakorth? Come with us!'
'Dréri! Náth! That's enough dancing for now!'
'I am sorry I do not recognize you, my friend, but who is your companion?'
'Aye, that's enough tales for now. Let's not keep King Thorin waiting!'
'Did you not hear me? We must go! The King Under the Mountain has summoned us!'
'Walk with me, [placeholder].'
'Well, I...suppose we have waited long enough.'
'Before we begin, I would like to thank each of you for honouring me with your presence.'
'Durin's Folk know peace once more, and Erebor is--'
